results.brief_description: Tells the history of Scotland’s industry from the industrial revolution to the technologies of oil and nuclear power.

results.title: Prospect for a city
results.creator_credit: Henry Cooper, Alan Harper and Harper Films
results.brief_description: Edinburgh is an outstanding example of a planned city and this film was made to mark the bi-centenary of the plans of the first architect, James Craig. Today modern ideas of town planning are being incorporated in the old city of squares and vistas.

results.title: Prophet of truth
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Jesus teaching the crowds in the temple; the woman caught in adultery is brought before the Pharisees in the temple; Jesus disperses her accusers ‘let he who is without sin cast the first stone’; Jesus cures the Centurion’s servant; Jesus cures the blind man; Jesus confronts the Pharisees and condemns their hypocrisies; Barrabas kills a Roman soldier during a riot; Jesus talking to Nicodemus in the olive grove.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia

results.title: Prophecy
results.creator_credit: Susumu Hani, Kyushiro Kusakabe and Hiroshima-Nagasaki Publishing Committee Film Department
results.brief_description: An anti-nuclear film with footage from recently declassified films and photographs from the US Archives graphically showing Hiroshima and Nagasaki after the atomic bomb explosions. Also includes scenes of the 1953 testing of a hydrogen bomb in Nevada. Focuses on the wounds, scars, radiation sickness, and suffering. Questions the American build-up of nuclear arms.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Susumu Hani, Kyushiro Kusakabe and Hiroshima-Nagasaki Publishing Committee Film Department
results.description: An anti-nuclear film with footage from recently declassified films and photographs from the US Archives graphically showing Hiroshima and Nagasaki after the atomic bomb explosions. Also includes scenes of the 1953 testing of a hydrogen bomb in Nevada. Focuses on the wounds, scars, radiation sickness, and suffering. Questions the American build-up of nuclear arms.

results.title: Property for all
results.brief_description: The possession of some property is rendered possible for the people of Germany through the fruits of their labour. Using examples of four people working in different factories, shows how television sets, modern furniture, refrigerators, washing machines, carpets, motor cars, can be acquired.

results.title: Properties of waves
results.brief_description: Describes the refraction of waves and illustrates their compression and expansion. Demonstrates and explains both the effects of waves crossing each other and the Doppler effect.

results.title: Properties of Nuclear Radiation
results.creator_credit: D Carswell, Sydney Scientific Film Society and University of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Deals with the origin and properties of three types of radiation: alpha, beta and gamma. Examines each type pf radiation, indicates their more important properties and outlines their particular fields of activity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: D Carswell, Sydney Scientific Film Society and University of New South Wales

results.title: Properties of matter. Part 5. Surfaces
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg defines “surfaces”, describes the surface properties of a liquid, shows what is meant by surface tension, demonstrates how it may be controlled and modified, describes the basic laws of friction, illustrates the effect of molecular surface layers in reducing friction and demonstrates the principles of lubrication.
results.description: Sir Lawrence Bragg defines “surfaces”, describes the surface properties of a liquid, shows what is meant by surface tension, demonstrates how it may be controlled and modified, describes the basic laws of friction, illustrates the effect of molecular surface layers in reducing friction and demonstrates the principles of lubrication.

results.title: Properties of matter. Part 4. Plastics and rubbers
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg compares naturally and artificially produced plastics, describes their structure, illustrates how simple molecules by chemical reaction are transformed into macro-molecules, shows the manufacture of a plastic, and describes and illustrates the constitution of rubber. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Properties of matter. Ep. 1. Solids, liquids and gases
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg illustrates the different forms which water can take; shows how these changes in form depend upon changes in temperature; compares the three divisions of matter, and discusses latent heat and pressure. Suitable for secondary level.
